result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle J Schneider was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property (Over $2500), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(2)(d).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Original restitution request was for $15,949.25. Defendant has paid $8,166.00 prior to sentencing. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.
09/28/15 RESTITUTION AMOUNT CORRECTED FROM DISTRICT ATTORNEY'S OFFICE.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Inform agent of all prescriptions, sign releases.

No Contact with any of the victims or their residences. Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
Complete the 180 Diversion program. Continue with Mental Health/psychological treatment. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

from 4th Dimension Sobriety and letter from 180 Diversion program dated 8/19/15

Defendant Kyle J Schneider in court with Attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Kuhary makes statements.  Rebecca Scott from 180 Diversion program makes statements.  Pamela S. makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  4 YEARS    **CONCURRENT**     NOTE:  Probation may terminate after 2 years if deemed appropriate by agent  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with any victims or their residences 
____Complete 180 Diversion program
____Continue with Mental Heath / Psychological treatment
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  $15,949.25 (Defendant paid $8,166.00) - balancing remaining is $7,783.25 (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

Felony Warnings, Voting Rights and Firearms Warnings provided to defendant

Dated 08/19/15, from 180 JV diversion, giving update of Defendant's program participation.
Sentencing hearing on September 16, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Kyle J Schneider in court with Attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  Parties are not ready to proceed to sentencing today due to Defendant's participation in 180 Diversion program.  Court will adjourn so parties can work out resolution.   Any proposals that would not involve sentencing on 9/16/16 are to be submitted by 9/9/15.  Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on August 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
filed by the state
Read-in list filed by the state
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Kyle J Schneider in court with Attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files read-in list. Defendant enters a no contest plea to Counts #1, 2, 3 and 4 on information.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Counts #1-4.  Counts #5-20 on information are dismissed and read-in.  Court also reads-in all counts on read-in list filed by the state.  Attorney Kuhary requests an adjourned date for sentencing.   Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Kuhary requests a plea and sentence date. Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on May 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kyle J Schneider in court with attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Kuhary states that Defendant was not able to enroll in 180 JV diversion program at this time, but they would backdate his enrollment if he is accepted at a later date. The State does not object to adjournment so that Defendant can get into 180 JV diversion program. Atty Kuhary request to set another hearing in 60-90 days.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kyle J Schneider in court with Attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kuhary requests an adjournment so that Defendant can pay some restitution and therefore be able to accept state's offer.  Defendant is involved in process of obtaining a loan with his mother and also in the process of getting into 180 diversion program.  Court sets a review date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
